headline: Stock Market Today, Jan. 27: UnitedHealth Group Plunges Almost 20% After Weak Earnings
summary: Investors reassess this healthcare giant in wake of profit collapse and Medicare worries, today, Jan. 27, 2026.

headline: Health Insurers Weigh on the Dow, While S&P 500 Sets Fresh Record
summary: An ugly day for health-insurer stocks weighed on indexes after news that the Trump administration wants to hold Medicare rates almost flat next year.  Humana UnitedHealth Elevance Health  and  CVS Health  were the S&P 500’s four worst performers, all tumbling 14% or more.  In all, the health-insurance selloff erased $99 billion in market value across six hard-hit stocks Tuesday, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Humana, UnitedHealth, and CVS Stocks Plunge After Medicare Rates Blow
summary: Health-insurance stocks were plummeting Tuesday after the Trump administration proposed keeping Medicare rates roughly flat next year.  The plunge could overshadow the company’s fourth-quarter earnings, due at 10:55 a.m. Eastern time.  CVS Health  stock plummeted 8.9% and  Humana  tumbled 12.4%.

headline: Medicare Shock Wipes Out Nearly $100 Billion in Market Value
summary: Tuesday's selloff in health-insurance stocks erased nearly $100 billion in market value, according to Dow Jones Market Data. Here's a breakdown of losses based on 4 p.m. ET prices:    ⬇️ UnitedHealth: $62.

headline: Trump Medicare rates: Healthcare's 'brokenness' isn't going away
summary: UnitedHealth (UNH) reported disappointing quarterly results on Tuesday and noted that it expects revenue to decline. Meanwhile, the Trump Administration proposed keeping Medicare Advantage reimbursement rates nearly flat next year. This policy would impact UnitedHealth and other health insurers like Humana (HUM), CVS (CVS), and Elevance (ELV).Mizuho Americas healthcare equity strategist Jared Holz joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss Medicare rates and the state of the healthcare industry at large.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Wednesday's big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
summary: The S&P 500 jumped to a fresh all-time high and closed at a record on Tuesday.

headline: UnitedHealth Stock Plunges 20%—Here's What's Driving the Huge Decline
summary: UnitedHealth Group shares tumbled Tuesday after the health insurer reported disappointing earnings and the Trump administration announced Medicare rates would be effectively unchanged next year.

headline: Health Insurers in Shock After Medicare Holds Line on 2027 Payments
summary: Big companies lose nearly $90 billion in market capitalization after Medicare proposed a relatively flat rate increase for next year.

headline: UnitedHealth stock plunges, leads insurers lower after Trump Medicare spending plan surprise
summary: Health insurance stocks fell hard Tuesday morning as investors digested a CMS report proposing a lower-than-expected increase to 2027 Medicare Advantage plans.

headline: Why Elevance Health (ELV) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of health insurance provider Elevance Health (NYSE:EVH) fell 11.4% in the morning session after industry peer UnitedHealth reported a significant drop in quarterly earnings and projected a revenue decline for 2026, creating concerns about rising medical costs for the entire sector.

headline: Medicare Shock Wipes Out $92 Billion in Market Value
summary: Tuesday's selloff in health-insurance stocks is on course to erase nearly $92 billion in market value, according to Dow Jones Market Data. Here's a breakdown of losses based on recent trading:    ⬇️ UnitedHealth: $58.

headline: UnitedHealth, CVS, Other Insurer Stocks Slide on Medicare Proposal
summary: Major insurance stocks sank after The Wall Street Journal reported the Trump administration is proposing roughly flat rates for Medicare insurers next year, far less than Wall Street expected.    Shares of Medicare insurer Humana skidded one-fifth Tuesday morning.

headline: Health insurers slide after 2027 Medicare Advantage payments proposal underwhelms
summary: Investing.com -- U.S. health insurers slid on Tuesday after the Trump administration proposed a much lower-than-anticipated increase to payments from next year’s Medicare Advantage plans.

headline: Humana, UnitedHealth, CVS Stocks Tumble After Medicare Rates Blow
summary: Health-insurance stocks were plummeting Tuesday after the Trump administration proposed keeping Medicare rates roughly flat next year.  CVS Health  stock plummeted 9% and  Humana  tumbled 19%.  Elevance Health  fell 11%, making the stocks the four worst  performers.

headline: U.S. Managed Care Insurers To Post Lower Q4 2025 Net Income Amid Higher Costs
summary: Leading publicly traded US managed care insurers are expected to report both sequential and year-over-year declines in net income for the fourth quarter of 2025.

headline: UnitedHealth, Humana, CVS Dive On Flat 2027 Medicare Advantage Rates; UNH Earnings Mixed
summary: Wall Street expected a 5% boost to Medicare Advantage payments. UnitedHealth's mixed earnings and guidance doesn't help.

headline: Wall Street mixed on a wave of corporate earnings as the Federal Reserve meets
summary: Wall Street was mixed early Tuesday as corporate earnings stream in ahead of a Federal Reserve decision on interest rates this week.  Nasdaq futures climbed 0.6%.  The Dow is being dragged down partially due to a sharp decline in United Health and other health insurers after the government issued a projected Medicare Advantage rate increase of less than 1% for 2027.
